Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: redblueyes
Reviews.Content: Catching up on some reviews. I stayed here 6 months ago and I thought it was a great hotel! I will definitely return when I go back to LA. It was an easy VERY quick drive to Myan Theater (a fantastic club BTW). I just stayed one night but everything seemed just fine to me, clean, comfortable. I see some recent terrible reviews, but I had no issues whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES in the hotel room”
Reviews.Author: sfromd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip 3/15/12 I awoke the next morning to ROACHES on the ceiling and desks. This hotel was deplorable. The worst I have ever stayed at. Thank God my wife and kids were not with me. They also stated a mysterious 2% tax would be added on which was unpublished and coulldnt be explained. Please avoid this hotel. It was like the crack infested drug hotels you would see on a movie.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and noisy”
Reviews.Author: nkk0719
Reviews.Content: The bathroom had alot of hair on floor,towels were dirty we had to go to the front desk and ask for new ones,we found a toothbrush by the bed,you can hear other people from other rooms and beds smelled funky,breakfast sucked too,for $110 is was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Pao_A
Reviews.Content: This comfort inn has lower standard than others. Too noisy, room is small, pillow is old. Free Wifi but didn't work. I cannot access to any website. We feel that its neighborhood is not safe for women to walk at night. Luckily, we stayed only 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Overall...ok”
Reviews.Author: tuffy26l
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend of a half marathon race. It was close to downtown without being super expensive. Room was decent and I liked that there was a window in the bathroom, especially since the weather was very nice. One negative thing I have to say is that reception somehow gave us the wrong room. They told us the number, but the original keys did not work. Then we got keys that worked, but they also gave another guest keys to our room so we had someone walk into our room at one point. They also would not allow us to check in early, which I know is a convenience factor, but I have never had an issue with that before at a Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for one night”
Reviews.Author: desert_bird
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in this hotel as we had some work at downtown and its proximity to subway station. While searching for hotels, I found that it is difficult to find a decent hotel in that area without paying $$$. I found this Comfort Inn to my surprise to be clean, well maintained and decent interiors. The breakfast was pretty good with some varieties and better than other motels of similar category. The rooms were small compared to Arizona standard but come on! this is downtown LA. I guarantee that other hotels in that area will be no better.Overall, agreeing to the fact that this is no resort destination, I will recommend this hotel. This hotel perfectly served the purpose of its location and provides the facilities expected from a two star motel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it is portrayed”
Reviews.Author: Mwinschel
Reviews.Content: We just finished staying here for a 3 day trip. I had not booked the rooms and by the time I saw the reviews of this place I was terrified and ready to cancel my trip,but it was past the point that I could do so. While the rooms were small and need some updating, we found them to be well appointed and very clean. It is not the most upscale section of town but we had no reason to be worried for our own safety. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tiago_ken
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice room. The beds were comfortable. Ask for a quiet room at the back of the hotel. There is no noise. Breakfast is not that bad (=> comfort inn standards). The location is a bit frightening but only at night ;-) There is a subway/metro station just 10 minutes walk away. This is a good overnight hotel for turists. Book in advance and get great deals !

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL HAS BED BUGS! DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVIS E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn at 1710 W. 7th St, Los Angeles, CA 90017 from August 21st, 2011 to August 23rd, 2011. During my stay I had the absolute worst experience. When I first arrived in the room, I noticed the carpet was stained beyond belief and there was a strong odor of must in the room. I tried to turn on the TV to find out that it was not working and neither was the remote. The next day I woke up with bites all over my back, sides of my body, and legs. I originally felt like it may have been an allergic reaction to the detergent on the sheets. The following day I woke up worse with bites all over my neck, face, feet, and more on my back. I searched the mattress thoroughly looking for bed bugs. Sure enough I found the source of bed bugs along with brown streaks on the white sheets consistent with a bed bug problem. I informed an employee and they said management would call me. I had to throw all of my clothes away (including my shoes, backpack, laptop case all due to egg infestation), miss a day of work, and purchase $35 worth of medication which I expect to be reimbursed for. The manager Oscar [--] has ignored and not returned any of my calls and now the hotel has blocked my number. I wanted to make sure this never happens to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: Sam J
Reviews.Content: On arrival we had to wait as lots of people checking in. Eventually got to room, only to find a loud noise in the bathroom. Informed the duty manager who was by himself, checking people in. Had to go down and eventually the duty manger came and sorted problem which was the toilet cistern. As it was after 10.00, and hadn't eaten all day. We went out. As it was awarm day, thought we'd walk, but soon changed our mind as we saw drunks and the street didn't look safe. We then went by car and saw 4-5 Police cars, looked like a raid. When we went to a near by restaurant, we were told not to go out on foot at night. On our return, we found bed bugs and cockroaches in the hotel room. We eventually checked out and moved to the Holiday Inn, much better. We were told that the hotel would pay compnesation for the inconvenience and the extra cost. But now Oscar Gonzales the General Manager has not returned my calls and making a compliant to ChoiceHotels was a waste of time, they said they could not do any thing as the Mr Gonzales has said he will not be paying any compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again, that is for sure”
Reviews.Author: MROD5
Reviews.Content: This is a decent looking hotel from the outside ONLY!!!! It is also in a street that makes you feel like you are in Tijuana, Mexico. The rooms are so old, the wall paper on the walls are probably still there from when this hotel was built. The conforters are stained with who knows what. The comforters also have cigarette burns. One of the queen beds looked like they didn't change the sheets, luckily there were two beds to choose from. The bathrooms are old. I did not want to walk a lot because the carpet was filthy!! I stayed still in one place in the bed because I wasn't 100 percent the sheets were clean. I regret paying $112 for one night in this cheap [--] hotel. Look somewhere else please. This is from a person who is not picky. oh and the service was "blah" receptionist had me waiting for 15 minutes while she was clocking in and preparing for her shift. She didn't speed up to help me, she took her precious time so that is why service was not good. Another rthing, the breakfast sucked!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dan256
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 days at the hotel. Appreciate that it is close of the metro station (3 blocs) as we did not had a car, but always travel with public transportation (easy and clean). Area is a bit scary but we always make sure to be back at the hotel before the sunset. Breakfast basic but good (always the same every morning, no variety). Staff very helpfull. WI-FI was variable in the room but fast in the lobby. Computer in the lobby did not work during our stay, asked a few times why, but seems that the technicien did not come to repair. Rooms: we were on the 3rd floor: clean, no bugs (checked completely), small and basic. Would need some refurbishind (carpet, linen and paint). Overall satisfied of the hotel and our first stay in LA. Would recommend as it is a good value for the price and close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches.....stay away”
Reviews.Author: yanet415
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we are choice hotel members. Yes location seems a bit scary but I didn't want to let it ruin our vacation to universal studios so I let it go. But what happened 1st thing we walk into our Room should of been my reality check to check out in leave. Since I have a 14 month baby I wanted to make sure I put his formula in the frig and I found cockroaches in there...I have a phobia so I yelled for my husband and ran downstairs to tell the front desk....I made a big complaint and told the guy at the front desk..he was nice enough to switch us saying that sometimes tourist bring them. He stated that they had been getting complaints from the second floor only but that he would switch us to the third floor so we went for it being confident with what he said plus we didn't want to miss one day at universal studio....so on the third floor it was supposes to be a suite but looked just like a regular room only thing it had diff was a flat screen with a balcony so that made it a suite I guess..I did my inspection again and said ok we can try this again but worst decision ever...today I found a cockroache in the bathroom at 8 am. I woke up my husband fast to kill it and we put it in a bag. I walked so pissed off to the office and made a bigger complaint on there cleanliness of this place..I told the front clerk and he seemed concern for us as I told him I have a phobia of cockroaches. I told him now I gotta make sure I dont take one home in my luggage or my sons toys. He was like I can get a cleaning person to go up to your room I was like for what, the damage is done ....I feel gross I stayed there. ohhh and to top it off when my husband went to drop the keys the front clerk lady told my husband the worst excuse.....saying its summer time so they usually come out around this time....I was like really..what a damn excuse...I am making a complaint to this membership I have with choice hotels cause I don't trust them anymore....

Reviews.Title: “Some good, Some bad”
Reviews.Author: SactoGamer
Reviews.Content: Also known as Comfort Inn City Center, the West 7th location of Comfort Inn in Los Angeles isn't half-bad. There were, though, a couple of things worth noting. First off, the room and hotel were rather clean. I've stayed in some pretty bad hotels in the Los Angeles area (which you might notice if you read my other reviews) and this really was one of the better ones I've stayed in. It was also relatively quiet and the service staff was kind and helpful. Example: Right during check-in, I brushes the sleeve of my dress shirt against some wet paint that wasn't well marked. I immediately notified the gal at the front desk. She took my shirt, cleaned it, ironed it, and had it back to me within 20 minutes. I was impressed. As for the bad, the free WiFi did not work for much of the trip. This is extremely frustrating when you're on a business trip and have work to do. The door to our room was extremely difficult to open, making a loud noise whenever it was opened or closed. The room itself, while clean, was small and very cramped with two queens in it. Waffles were advertised as part of the free breakfast, yet they were nowhere to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back there”
Reviews.Author: bokka23
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 years ago (July 2009). Same day as Michael Jacksons funeral. Convenient to railway station and downtown LA. Clean rooms and comfortable BUT crappy & smelly hall ways and lift. The breakfast area a bit small. Our WORSE experience is when we got home - back in Australia, and realised that my evening ladies jacket and a ladies pair or shoes were taken from out suitcase - a big disappointment - we had our 'do not disturb' sign on as we just did not feel comortable with the cleaning staff around the room areas. I know my review is a bit late but thought I just had to put it on line.

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: AZ4Now
Reviews.Content: I have made several recent visits to downtown LA for meetings and was looking for a decent place at a reasonable price. This Comfort Inn fills the bill nicely. The building is not new but there are signs that it is pretty well maintained and one of the rooms I had appeared to have been recently refurbished. I requested the 2nd or 3rd floor which seemed a little quieter. I found the staff to be very pleasant and accommodating and was particularly pleased with the way the room was cleaned. The free Wi-Fi had good signal strength in my room on some days, but not others. However, connecting in the lobby area was never a problem. The included breakfast was the expected juice, cereal, muffins, bagels etc. plus a waffle maker that was a nice extra. The breakfast room is fairly small and can get crowded, so I usually ate soon after they opened at 6:30AM. The neighborhood may put off a lot of people and you probably will not want to take a late evening stroll, but my wife and I walked to several nearby restaurants and had no problems or concerns. In fact during the afternoon the shops have a street market atmosphere, much like those we have seen overseas. A couple of restaurants we liked were Langer's Deli (Corner of 7th and Alvarado) that is open for breakfast and lunch only. They are fairly expensive but the food was good. Heading east on 7th about the same distance you can find a Little Cesar's Carry Out Pizza and to its left a delightful bakery and cafe (La Dolce Vita-1551 W 7th). La Dolce Vita serves salads, sandwiches and pasta dishes in addition to espresso and other specialty drinks and became our favorite spot for dinner. If you want to stay in downtown LA at a reasonable price, this Comfort Inn is certainly worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it was described to be! Beware--old and grubby.”
Reviews.Author: babybonkin
Reviews.Content: The rooms were so cramped in with two beds instead of what they were built for (1) that you really have to do some fancy feet work to move around! Our window would not shut, so we called the front desk. They did not have a mantenance person on duty, so the front desk girl tried to figure it out. Needless to say, we were told we would have to wait until the next day, so we just dealt with it. The bedspreads had big stains on them, and the carpet needed a good cleaning. The breakfast room was so small you could not move around, let alone find a place to sit! Beware, they charge you per day to park your car in an uncovered parking lot!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting place to stay / amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: specialant
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. Like every two weeks. First of all, the staff was top notch. They worked with what they had. My first room had brown on the sheets - a ripped shower curtain, the AC didn't work and I was totally grossed out. I was switched to a better clean room and am happy in this room. The neighborhood does not feel safe. All vending machines were out of beverages and when I went to the desk they said there was no water. NO WATER! IN THE WHOLE PLACE!! The staff member was kind enough to give me one out of her personal supply. Breakfast was not bad. Again, get these receptionists out of this terrible hotel and put them where they belong - at a top notch hotel. It's such a waste that such lovely, kind people have so little to work with. It's like a top chef being given an onion and an edd and told to make a masterpiece.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property for the Price”
Reviews.Author: dmlandis
Reviews.Content: Comfort Inn was good for the price $62/night. It is close to Convention Center where I attended one day. The neighborhood isn't great but parking seems secure. Rooms are small but well appointed and my bed was very comfortable. There's an adequate continental breakfast downstairs. Also, they have a nice warm pool to relax. Main complaint is internet access. Unfortunately, only place to get wifi is in lounge. But if you need a place to stay that is close to downtown but not $150 a night, this would most likely be the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location, bad service, bad rooms, bad visit”
Reviews.Author: heilandsavior
Reviews.Content: Arrived to this hotel not knowing it was located in a bad part of LA, and the worst part was that the doors on the outside would not fully shut or lock, anyone can have access to all halls and the elevator, very unsafe. Then the room keys would never work, we had to get new keys made at least once every day. The room was horrible. The tv's color was completely messed up, the bed had a large brown stain on it, shower was dirty, lockbox broken, parking lot was full every night with no room to park, Wi-fi connection was horrible and slow. This Comfort Inn provided no comfort

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Friendly & Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: chopgreko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were pleasently surprised with the hotel. Parking per night was very cheap, the staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly. Our room was as it was on the internet, roomy clean and the balcony was large. Housekeeping made sure the room was completely stocked and cleaned every day. The free wifi was very good and most impressed with the breakfast spread every day. Juice coffee, pastries, toast, waffles, fresh fruit etc. The neighbourhood was not great though, didn't feel safe walking around. McDonalds, Starbucks and other convenience stores were close by. Overall I would stay here again, close to downtown it was at $7 cab ride to the staples center, really close to main attractions. The thing that was most important was the cleanliness of the room, and it was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING, toilet over flow.”
Reviews.Author: AmberRodwick
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have been going to an even here in LA for two years now and since we stayed here last year we thought it would be a great idea to stay again since the prices were good and it wasn't nasty hotel. Well, that was last year. THIS year as soon as we got into the room and used the restroom water started coming out from the under the toilet. So we left to our event and someone came in and fixed it. It seemed to be okay, then at 5 o'clock in the morning I get woken up to my boyfriend clearing all of our bags to the door, the water had leaked again but this time came into the hotel and literally flooded everything, getting our bags and clothes SOAKED with nasty sewer water! At first the water was clear, so we just put one of the comforters down and waited until it was 6:30 am to go let them know what happened again. In the mean time the water started turning brown and had diarrhea in it. I am still in the hotel as I write this waiting to be moved to ANOTHER room & waiting to get a full 100% refund. On top of everything before I went to bed there was a FLEA on my bed. I understand they are trying to do everything that they can but what really upsets me is that now it is 8:42 and we were told someone would be in here to at least clean it up by 8 and we would be moved shortly after that, no one has even stopped by our room and we wont be moved till 9:30. DON'T STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff, Room and service”
Reviews.Author: tif0803
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a concert at the Nokia Theater..The problems started as soon as we checked in..the lady at the front dest had a very bad attitude and was on the defensive for some reason..the bed only had sheets on it, went to shower and there were no face towels..called for some and they said they were out of them..and if I need anything I'd have to come down and get it..the sink was clogged. the toilet barely flushed, the shower knob would turn...It was horrible. Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Humble amenities in the middle of Downtown, but great service”
Reviews.Author: sarahboo999
Reviews.Content: My dad and I stayed at this Downtown Comfort Inn for 11 days while I looked for an apartment. The location is not the best, but the building is very quant and offers all basics. The room was just right and soon became home. Thank you to the staff. It was a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good service. But rooms wernt the best”
Reviews.Author: RichardWiggett
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and that was hard work we stayed in the room as least as we could make sure our day was packed full of stuff to do. The service and breakfast the same as any comfort inn was great but the rooms where old and a bit shabby, clean but old looking like my great Nan’s house!! The pool was as big as a bath tub and mega cold. It’s in the heart of Mexican village they are every where and in your face and a bit scary at times. The metro was down the road so we used that to get to universal studios but would get there at like 9am and then get a taxi back from the park at 11 so it was a case of bed and sleep. The rooms where clean but old. That’s about it really.

Reviews.Title: “There was a huge bug on the bed”
Reviews.Author: md2785
Reviews.Content: Though it looks fine when I see this hotel from outside, I feel a little bad walking the aisle.Then, I and my wife were shocked by detecting a bug on our bed. It was just before we went to bed in the middle of the night. When I inform the front desk, he offered me more luxurious room. However, I realized in the morning that I am bitten in the room. I think all rooms in that hotel are full of bugs so I don't recommend this hotel to anybody

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms and Service”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Person_Guy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Comfort Inn hotels and this one has by far been the best. The rooms are spotless and the service is superb. I will recommend this hotel to all visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad for the price paid!”
Reviews.Author: Huskies04
Reviews.Content: I was in L.A. for the pac 10 tournament last week and stayed at this place due to the cheaper price and close location to Staples Center. The room was decent sized and clean enough. No complaints about the service. The location of the hotel is indeed very questionable. Not the good part of L.A., thats for sure. But overall for the price, its not a bad deal staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Bobwins
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn while attending the Pac 10 basketball tournament at Staples recently. I read the negative reviews after I had already booked the hotel so was prepared for a bad experience. I found the hotel clean and comfortable. The beds were firm, there was free internet with good connection speeds and the linen was changed each day with no problems. The cable connection was poor, with very fuzzy picture. The A/C didn't seem to pump out that much cold air. The temperature outside was high 60's so I don't know how the unit would do if it was hot and humid in the summer. The hallways that were carpeted were vacumed daily. The painted cement walkways were washed each day we were there. The ice machine and pop machine was down the hall and worked fine. The complimentary continental breakfast each morning was a nice freebie. The room was crowded each morning but I enjoyed the apple juice, bagels, bananas, tea and cold breakfast cereal. The last day was the least busy so I was able to get a hot waffle but most days it was too busy to wait for the waffle maker. The hotel was about 1.5 miles from Staples so it was a brisk 25-30 minute walk each way. The hotel is west of the high rise office buildings and definitely has mostly Mexican residents. The store fronts and apartments all have iron grills on the windows and the sidewalks don't look like they get cleaned often. We walked back from Staples each night around 11PM but didn't have any troubles or meet anyone that looked threatening. There were families with children waiting for buses and the only time we got scared was walking under the freeway. There was a street person sleeping under a big piece of cardboard. We thought it was just a pile of rags and were startled when he sat up. There was at least one person sleeping under the freeway each time we passed by. We were not approached by any panhandlers. The ticket scalpers near Staples were the only nuisance. We met an older couple who were staying there and they said they walked to Staples during the day and then took a cab home at night. They said there were lots of cabs lined up outside Staples and it was only around $8 for the ride home. This hotel is probably at the outside limits of where we would stay in the future for the Pac10 tourney. The hotel was a lot cheaper than the Holiday Inn across the street from Staples, where we have stayed in the past. The Comfort Inn hotel room was actually better but the location is the main attraction of the Holiday Inn. I would recommend this as a good value as long as you are comfortable staying in an inner city neighborhood. There were lots of schools in the neighborhood and it appeared to be safe to me during our 4 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “BED MITES”
Reviews.Author: BedMites
Reviews.Content: BEWARE! I stayed at the hotel August 16-19, 2008. I was infected by bed mites which showed up as leisions on my skin about three days after I checked out. My doctor confirmed the infestation. I have attempted to bring this to the attention of the hotel management but they won't return my telephone call.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but location not nice”
Reviews.Author: Waveluver
Reviews.Content: We booked the Comfort Inn because we have been pleased with Comfort Inns in the past plus a lot of places were booked up. We arrived at 1:00 just to see if they could check us in before going to our conference. They readily checked us in at the front desk and were friendly and helpful with directions. The hotel and grounds were clean and pleasant. The swimming pool was sparkling clean. Our rooms were small but clean--a little worn but everything in good shape. No bugs or weird smells. The bed was comfy. They gave turn down service in the evening. The morning breakfast bar was very nice serving make your own waffles, very nice variety of muffins, cereals, fruit, juices, nice selection of bagels. They should have 2 waffle makers. I go into Los Angeles inner city at least one a year. I am used to what an inner city looks like and wasn't willing to pay the $300--$400 a night for places a few streets down. The hotel is safe with gated parking. I wouldn't walk around in that area at night, but saw nothing of suspect the evening we stayed...heard no gun shots, etc. It was just fine to spend one night. Don't know if I would want to have an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would notgo again”
Reviews.Author: udayverma
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have heeded the advice about the hotel.It all started on the wrong foot.i requested for non smoking was given smoking one with windows open to dispel any smell.Had to argue a lot to get another room,was told initially that it full but later on gave one seeing how disatisfied i was with their service.i was told initially that there is some problem with internet too but i guess they had kept the room that was on hold for me before infested with this problem.I must warn all travelers that if they need internet the should make them give you room with good signal strength.they have a common excuse of saying that we just got some problem with internet.the area around looks very unsafe even in day time.Downtown location looks tempting but believe me you have nothing in downtown and its better staying off in better neighbourhoods .if you havegals in ur group would def not recommend and if u are guys and just wanna place to take shelter may be or may be not.You simply can move in this area without vehicle and there is not any place nearby to eat or anything.Spend some extrabucks and stay somwhere else.If you are going to LA pay attention to safety of neighborhoods.And forgot to mention they charge 2$/day for parking and takes no responsibilty for any damage to your vehicle.Just when I arrived some gal grazed somebody's car and left and I doubt they did something as they can see what is happening on camera but front desk dint bother to come outside at all.

Reviews.Title: “Hotle ok but suspect location.”
Reviews.Author: Bowtell
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was ok. A bit worn around the edges but clean and reasonably comfortable. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Problem was with the location. When we booked, we were told it is near the LA convention centre (which it was) and conveniant for the metro (whihc it was). What they failed to mention was that this hotel is in a very suspect part of Downtown. Very run down, shopkeepers only seemed to speak Spanish and there was a hostile atmosphere. A shopkeeper was shot across the street on our first night. Had we been aware of the area, we would not have booked.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and incompetent management”
Reviews.Author: adamjr1968
Reviews.Content: The pictures, as usual, show something quite different then what you will see when you arrive. While the hotel itself is pleasant to look at the neighborhood leaves something to be desired. When we booked the hotel we were surprised by what seemed like such a great price to be only three miles from the LA convention center. Being from Chicago I might not have felt as insecure in this neighborhood as someone from Salt Lake City. To some the economically disadvantaged locals are more scary then the character I felt they brought to the place. Aside from the homeless begging (of which there were more near the convention center then in this neighborhood) we had no problems in the neighborhood. The room was quite a different story. Shortly after check in we discovered the first cockroach. I called down to the desk and was told we could be moved to another room but it would be of lesser quality, which we found difficult to believe, and in close proximity. I left messages for the manager, then Wednesday, and twice a day until he called me on Saturday to inform me that he entered the room in my absence and without my permission. He had taken so long to return my call, he said, because he manages three properties. He saw nothing and would do nothing. Initially he told me that they have never had roaches in the hotel but later in the discussion mentioned that they were spot treating for roaches in another area of the hotel. When we returned that night we found another roach which we killed and bagged to be sent to Comfort Inn's corprate office. I attempted to speak to the manager for the remainder of my stay with no success. One bright and shining star was a young desk clerk named Tawnee. She attentively listened and transcribed my thoughts into a binder the manager was supposed to review. She attempted to get my room rate reduced, was approved by her supervisor, and denied by the manager. Only after I called Choice Hotels to begin the complaint process and under threat of sending the offending insect to Comfort Inn headquarters did my rate get reduced from $69.99 to $39.99. Why didn't I just switch hotels? The town was booked except for rooms with rates around $150.00 more per night which I simply can't afford.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! Be advised on the location.”
Reviews.Author: A_Mom_from_Arizona
Reviews.Content: The location to the city and nearby sights is suitable, if you dont mind driving thru the dirty streets. I was a little intimidated by the location - this hotel is located within the hispanic community/barrios - something the web page neglects to inform travelers of. As a matter of fact, there is a project located right across the street. Upon check-In, the room we were 'given' was okay to the view but the smell was of urine covered up w carpet cleaner or air freshner. If you require security and you're traveling w children I would not recommend this Comfort Inn. I usually enjoy the reasonable pricing and amenities of the Comfort Inns but this is one I will surely gladly pass up on!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: 1Trojan
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend the Comfort Inn LA City Center to anyone. Despite it's convenient location to Downtown Los Angeles, including the Staples Center, the hotel staff were less than competent. During a three night stay, we were awaken twice by the front-desk staff; first at 1:30 am to inquire whether my wife (whom answered the phone) had actually checked in. If this weren't inconsiderate enough, I received a second call from the front desk at 3:45 am, in which the gentleman advised me that he called in error and proceeded to hang up. At this time, as I was angered by the second inconvenience, I called back to inquire why we received yet a second call in the middle of the night. The gentleman advised me that he initially thought I was checking out later that day, but that he later realized I was leaving in two days. I was outraged by this because even had I been scheduled to check out later that morning, check out time is 11am, and there would be no reason to bother me at 3:45 am to inquire about when I would actually be checking out. Just when I figured I'd seen the last of the staff's incompetence, upon checkout, i was advised that i was being charged $4.00/day for parking. I refused to pay this, as the fee was not not made public on the Hotel.com website, nor was it displayed anywhere on the hotel's premises. To be fair, the room itself was clean and sufficient for our needs; however, the staff's incompetence overshadowed what, otherwise, would have been an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you can put up with a few annoyances”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Some people will not like this hotel. However, if you can get a good deal and can put up with a few annoyances, the hotel is OK. When we checked in, the night clerk was a jerk. He put us in a small room in the back. We asked to change to a balcony room in the front, which was 50% larger. He said he would raise our rate from $64 to $99. The next morning, the day clerk gave us a balcony room and kept the rate at $64. The room itself was clean and the bathroom was sparkling clean. If you are fussy with bathrooms, you won't be disapponted. The carpet in the hallway outside the room was very dirty. The shower had very little (i.e. none) hot water at night. However, there was plenty of hot water in the morning. The neighborhood was a little seedy, but so is most of the area around downtown LA. There are some panhandlers, but the area is fairly safe. A lot of Mexicans live in the area. The hotel caters to bus tours on weekdays, so there is no problem with parking. However, on Fridaya and Saturday, there are no bus tours and the parking lot was busrting from the seams. The location was geat being in cental LA. It was an easy drive to Burbank to watch Jay Leno and another easy dirve to Culver City to watch Jeopardy or Wheel of Fortune. The free breakfast was wonderful. There were bananas, bagels, muffins, toast and waffles. The waffles were excellent because there were cooked to order (you cook them youself). I would stay here again provided I can get a good rate in one of the balcony rooms in the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SSNR
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the internet as it was supposed to be a good central location for our 10 days in los angeles.When our family arrived the hotel looked like a refugee camp for mexicans.Went up to the room and found it to be filthy.In addition to this the pool was out of order and when we asked when it was going to be fixed we were told "I dont know".I pride myself on being street wise but i have never been so scared in all my life.To say the neighbourhood is dodgy is the understatement of the year.Instead of staying for 10 days we stayed approx 30 mins and got out of there and went to Santa Monica. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed at this hotel first time visiting from ENGLAND,, the staff was realy very helpfull made us feel very welcome breakfast was realy nice the room was realy clean with fresh linen fresh smelling well maintained great freindley housekeeping we were there for 5 nights and every night we slept realy good already have made pre res for next yr to stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “most guests were equally nervous”
Reviews.Author: 3dvizwiz
Reviews.Content: Our group chose to stay at this hotel based on its proximity to another "conference" hotel located 5 blocks away, hoping to catch that hotel's bus to the LA convention center. We never did do that (i.e., walk the 5 blocks), due to the horrible neighborhood. The rooms were very worn, having filthy carpeting and stained wallpaper. I refused to sit on the chair in the room, being unwilling to guess at what had caused those particular stains. Since a number of the other guests (convention attendees) had apparently chosen this hotel based on similar reasoning (and the normally good reputation of the hotel chain), we were able to joke about it while huddled together at breakfast, but no one looked very happy or comfortable. I'm personally very happy that the convention in question will not be in Los Angeles next year, as I find the city in need of a wash in general...

Reviews.Title: “Better than most”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after being dissapointed with other hotels in the Los Angeles area. It was reasonable and pretty clean considering the price. The area was not the best, however the people did not bother you and we were able to find parking spaces...barely. The breakfast was nice and room service provided enough towels for all of us. If your looking for luxury, this is not the place to stay, if your looking for a place to lay your head. Comfort Inn is it.

Reviews.Title: “I FEARED FOR MY LIFE!”
Reviews.Author: fonz333
Reviews.Content: The location is HORRID. My husband and I arrived thinking that this was going to be an okay hotel since it was a well-known name, and since it was recommended as part of a travel package through Expedia. However, as soon as we drove up we knew we were in for it. We found the very last parking spot in the parking lot, which was locked up at night (so you had no place to park after dark), however I didn't even feel safe keeping my car in the lot directly below our room. The cars in the lot were all jammed in so there was no hope of getting our car out again until the morning anyways. On top of that, there were numerous thugs hanging out everywhere, and the staff at the front desk was flat out RUDE. We got to our room and the comforter smelled like urine, and the patio was infested with mosquitoes. But the best was yet to come...after a long flight my husband and I decided to stay in for the night, so we ran across the street to a convenience store to get a six pack of beer. However, at the store we were in line with an ugly prostitute who was arguing with the clerk that she didn't want to buy the box of 10 condoms when she only needed one, so could she just buy one? After getting our beer (which was much needed by this point) we settled into the urine-stained sheets on our bed only to hear a group of guys fighting in the parking lot below us. Calling the front desk got us no where (they could've cared less that bullets were about to fly). Also, all night long doors slammed open and shut and questionable noises were heard in the room next door (use your imagination). I still cannot believe that this hotel was advertised by Expedia (we got our money back). Needless to say, after a sleepless night wondering if we were going to get shot by a stray bullet or if our rental car would be on cinder blocks in the morning, we checked out and headed up to Beverly Hills, where we should have stayed in the first place except for the fact that until then I had believed a good deal could still be had. Well, I was had. From now on, it's the Elan Modern Hotel all the way (and it's cheap too!).

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend staying here. The rate was good, but not good enough. The area is questionable to say the least. When I arrived at my room, there were no pillows on the bed and no remote control. I called the front desk four times and never did get a remote. The room was shabby and the bathroom was not very clean. The noise from the parking lot and the street was very loud at times. If there are no parking spots in the main parking lot, you have to park in the back which feels a little unsafe. If there are no spots there, you have to park on the street at a meter. I dreaded staying in the room and would certainly not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you LAFD!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from August 8-10. Our first night, we were dead tired from traveling and needed a soda. So, we went to the vending machines on all three floors to get what we needed. However, upon opening the Diet Coke and 2 Sprites (they were out of Coke) they were flat and tasted disgusting. The date on the sodas were from 2003. Although this isn't necessarily the hotel's fault, it was disheartening because we didn't feel safe walking to the corner store. The management gave us bottles of water in the morning to compensate us?! The rooms were fairly clean and we got a good night's sleep the nights we were there. It was good for the price! The area was very shady and the front desk clerk gave us information on riding the bus. While this was very kind of her, we were a bit out of our element in this neighborhood. The local fire department gave us excellent advice and told us to rent a car, which we promptly did! Thanks to the LAFD, we had a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “first and last time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the room clean and comfortable , The staff lacking in social skills and a most disturbing incedent at one thirty am when a security employee tried to enter the room with out any notification , when the front desk was called they said it was a mistake that he was to check empty rooms onlyI dident sleep well after that to say the least and wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and that was enough. The carpeting in the hallways were filthy dirty going to the room. Looks like they haven't been replaced in 20 years. I guess the room was ok and it was clean but in the morning the shower prussure was terrible. I might as well had my son pour some water from the faucet on my head it was so bad. I felt like I didn't even take a good shower. Then we went to check out and they charged me $4.00 for parking when it said FREE parking on the internet on the days inn website and expedia and I think orbitz. They said free parking upon availability and i said "Yeah, it is all available, there are tons of spots right there in your lot!" They made no sense. So, I would not stay here again but at least there was no bugs like we had the next night at days inn,lol.

Reviews.Title: “comfort inn caution”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Comfort Inn twice. The first time was alright, the second time the room was unacceptable and management didn't care. The location is close to downtown but the neighborhood is a little seedy. While there is plenty of parking you may have to push aside empty boxes of stolen merchandise if you have to park in the back lot. I would only stay here if you got a good rate and just needed a place to sleep.
